messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:47): roc: can you think of any Mozilla developers who might take an interest in picking up work on implementing support for the progress element?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:47): https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=514437
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:48): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: have you pinged volkmar about it?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:49): but I will
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:50): wonders what timezone volkmar is in
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:50): CET I guess
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:57): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: we seem to have a product for the alt-techniques doc already
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:57): http://www.w3.org/html/wg/tracker/products/9
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:59): and I just now added one for HTML+RDFa
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:59): http://www.w3.org/html/wg/tracker/products/10
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:00): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: do you know if Yael Aharon frequents IRC?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:00): maybe I'll convert over the 4 TrackerRequest bugs
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:00): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I don't know
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:00): there is a "yael" on #webkit but I dunno if she pays attention
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:02): ah, OK
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:13): since we don't have a proper URL parsing spec yet: What's the path in this url? href="   ftp://foo/a   "
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:14): what about href="    ftp://foo/a%20  "
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:15): Where can I find the last URL parsing spec rev before IETF buried it?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:16): is getting annoyed at politics getting in the way of implementation work
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:17): $ hg clone http://bitbucket.org/DanC/urlp urlp
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:18): well, there it is
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:18): Strip leading and trailing space characters from w.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:19): now if we could agree on what the space characters are...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:20): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: thanks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:21): for now, I'm going to pretend that space characters are ' ', '\r', '\n' and '\t', since that's what most of the above-DOM layers of Gecko think
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:21): is quite unhappy that HTML5 doesn't agree
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:21): http://www.w3.org/html/wg/href/draft is what you are looking for I suppose but it's not entirely up to date with all latest findings (but then nothing is)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:22): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: thanks. I found the most up-to-date version of that doc from DanC's bitbucket
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:28): http://twitter.com/Rich_Clark/status/14282319673
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:29): http://twitter.com/gtrufitt/statuses/14219697892
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:29): "Why is there no input type=year in HTML5 forms?"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:29): I don't know the answer to that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:29): I do know it wasn't in Web Forms 2.0
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:29): or I don't think it was at least
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:29): checks
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:30): but also don't know that the use cases would be
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:32): thanks
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:33): be interesting to know the use case
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:34): localized version of type=year could be way more rich than you can get with type=number
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:36): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: what would a localized version do?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:37): for certain locales it could offer different calendars as input
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:37): but then it depends on the use case whether that would actually work, of course
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:37): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I think the start and end of years in different calendars don't match Gregorian years
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:38): yeah...
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:53): I hate waiting for builds
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:53): whines to no one in particular
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (11:53): Get a faster computer?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:59): whines about Apple's faster computers being unnecessarily huge in size
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:00): I like the build times on my i7 box that's smaller than a Mac Pro and that Apple wouldn't sell me
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:03): of course, things could always be faster
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:03): blames C++ for having an archaic file dependency model
